newsitem.title: USA: AMERICA ONLINE MEMBERSHIP, ADS BOOST Q4.
newsitem.headline: AMERICA ONLINE MEMBERSHIP, ADS BOOST Q4.

text.p: America Online Inc said Thursday that its fourth quarter operating results benefited from strong growth in membership and advertising, commerce and transaction revenues.
The company reported a fourth quarter loss of $0.12 per share, including what it called timing adjustments made after talking to the Securities and Exchange Commission.
Before timing adjustments, the company a profit of $0.09 per share for the quarter, compared with a 1996 fourth quarter profit of $0.14 a share.
Wall Street had been expecting the company to report profits of $0.07 a share, according to First Call.
The company also credited cost-savings, marketing efficiencies and improved member retention for fourth quarter results that came in above analysts' estimates.
It added 600,000 net new members in the fourth quarter, bringing its reach to 8,636,000 members worldwide as of June 30, 1997.
It said it surpassed 750,000 members internationally during the fourth quarter, just a year and a half after launching its first service in Germany.
The Dulles, Virginia-based Internet online service has about 8.6 million members worldwide.
